Key Match Events: The Mavericks lost by one point, 114-113, to the Phoenix Suns.
The Mavericks bench was outscored by the Suns bench, 28-9.
Jusuf Nurkic's split free throws with 0.8 seconds sealed the win for the Suns.
Pre-Game Insights: Jason Kidd has high hopes for the Mavericks' bench and expects them to deliver.
Kidd believes that the bench will get a chance to play and will be ready when called upon.
Post-Match Reflections: Jason Kidd was disappointed with the Mavericks' bench performance and emphasized the need for improvement.
Kidd believes that the team needs to find a way to get more energy and participation from the bench.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Luka Doncic led the Mavericks with 30 points, while Kyrie Irving added 29.
The Mavericks will play their next three games on the road, starting against the Denver Nuggets on Sunday.
Others: The Dallas Mavericks bench consists of players like Dereck Livelky II, Naji Marshall, Maxi Kleber, Quentin Grimes, Spencer Dinwiddie, Jaden Hardy, and Dwight Powell.
